textBox.richText: Age estimation from face images using Multivariate Boosting Idiap recently proposed and developed [1] a novel unified boosting framework. We applied this framework to the several face processing tasks, face detection, facial feature localisation, and pose classification, and use the same boosting algorithm and the same pool of features (Local Binary Patterns). This is in contrast with the standard approaches that make use of a variety of features and models, for example AdaBoost, cascades of boosted classifiers and Active Appearance Models.  The unified boosting framework covers multivariate classification and regression problems and it is achieved by interpreting boosting as optimization in the functional space of the weak learners. Thus a wide range of smooth loss functions can be optimized with the same algorithm. We extended recent work on TaylorBoost and used an empirical expectation formulation that minimizes the average loss to train real-time models using local binary features. This is achieved using look-up-tables as weak learners and multi-block Local Binary Patterns as features. The resulting boosting algorithms are simple, efficient and easily scalable with the available resources. The goal of this project is to leverage on the developed unified boosting framework and to apply it to the task of age estimation from face images. [1] Cosmin Atanasoaei, "Multivariate Boosting with Look-up Tables for Face Processing", PhD thesis 2012. http://publications.idiap.ch/index.php/publications/show/2315 The student will be using the BOB open source library ( http://idiap.github.com/bob/ ) developed at Idiap. The student should have a background in statistics or applied mathematics, optimization, linear algebra, signal processing, and machine learning. The applicant should also have strong programming skills and be familiar with MATLAB, C/C++, various scripting languages such as Python and with the Linux environment. Any applicant might undergo a series of tests including programming. The starting date is immediate. The appointment is for 6 months. Salary is 2000 CHF per month.
